title: Define Project Scope and Requirements (Revised)
description: This RFC outlines the creation of a comprehensive document detailing the requirements for the InclusivityAnalyzer tool. The document will include target user personas, use cases, desired features, data sources (internal and external such as company communications platforms, HR systems, and public data), API and service integration points (Slack, Google Workspace, etc.), security and privacy considerations (including GDPR and HIPAA compliance if applicable), performance and scalability requirements, accessibility, usability, cultural sensitivity, and a roadmap for implementing these requirements in phases. The document will also address design principles such as inclusivity, ethics, and user-centricity throughout the tool's lifecycle, with a focus on transparency and explainability of AI models used. It will outline the process for regular updates and reviews to ensure ongoing compliance and relevance. Additionally, this RFC emphasizes the importance of diversity in the development team, encouraging input from various backgrounds and experiences. Upon completion, this RFC will be reviewed by the project manager and other stakeholders for approval before moving forward to the next phase. The document should further outline the process for incorporating feedback from diverse perspectives during the development process. The assigned task is now with the 'task-decomposer'.

title: Design System Architecture (Revised) - Including Microservices Approach for Improved Scalability and Modularity
description: Design the overall system architecture, including components, data flow, integration points. Ensure the design is inclusive, follows best practices for diversity, accessibility, scalability, performance, security, and maintainability. Utilize microservices architecture to improve scalability and modularity. Detailed design should include: 1) Frontend interface for input and display of data, 2) Backend services for processing and analysis, 3) Database structure for storage, and 4) APIs for integration with other systems. Also, prioritize accessibility and usability in the design process.

description: Revised data model design for company communications, decisions, analysis results, and metadata related to inclusivity. This includes structuring the data for efficient querying and analysis while considering factors such as privacy, scalability, adaptability to different types of company structures, and tracking changes over time. The design incorporates version control mechanisms and is optimized for data integrity. Additionally, the model's flexibility allows it to be expanded with new features or modifications as necessary. To ensure clarity and maintainability, consider adding documentation outlining the structure, purpose, and relationships of each element in the data model.

title: Implement Security and Access Controls (Updated)
description: Develop comprehensive security measures and access controls to ensure data privacy, protect sensitive company information, and adhere to GDPR and other relevant regulations. This includes authentication, authorization, encryption, secure data storage, regular security audits, incident response planning, and continuous monitoring for potential threats. The implementation should follow best practices such as OWASP Top Ten, the principle of least privilege, and industry-standard security frameworks like NIST SP 800-53. Additionally, consider integrating with existing security tools for seamless operations.
